section.para: The module enables you, on behalf of your company (the beneficiary) to receive notification of banker's guarantees, and subsequent updates, from the Advising Bank. You can also send messages back to the bank for events that require your approval or acceptance in the ongoing transaction flow.

section.title: Terminology
section.para: Within this section of the help guide, "BR" and "Received Banker's Guarantee" are used interchangeably. The terms "record" and "transaction" both refer to entries in the system relating to the function being discussed.

section.title: Received Banker's Guarantee - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the Received Banker's Guarantee function, from the toolbar, select Trade Services > Banker's Guarantee Received.

section.title: Received Banker's Guarantee Functions
section.para: The menu for this module has the following groups of functions.

listitem.para: Send a free-format message to the Recipient Bank. A typical use of this feature could be to indicate that the guarantee can be redeemed as a follow-up to a given event.
View all existing Received Banker Guarantee records, that are not yet complete.
Display lists of existing Received Banker Guarantee records, according to specific search criteria.
Maintain Entity, Reference, Action Required, Unsigned, and Purged BRs.

section.title: Message to Bank
section.para: This section describes the Message to Bank part of the menu and the forms it uses. The Message to Bank function allows a message to be sent to the bank, relating to a specific transaction. This may be to inform them of the completion or cancellation of a Received Banker's Guarantee.

section.title: Message to Bank Options
section.para:
Send a free-format message to the Recipient Bank. This function provides options to create, control, accept and reject messages to the bank regarding Received Banker Guarantees.
From Existing BR
Create a message to the bank, relating to an existing Received Banker's Guarantee transaction.
Action Required
Displays any pending actions required to complete the forms.
Edit Transactions
Review, complete and submit Message to Bank records that you or another user have already created and saved, but not submitted.
Retrieve Unsigned
Review and submit Message to Bank records that you or another user have created, but have not been submitted due to lack of authority.

section.title: Message to Bank - Edit Transactions
section.para: This option allows a Message to Bank that you or another user have already started and saved, to be completed.

When selected, this option will present a list of Message to Bank records that have been prepared and saved by users in your bank, but not yet submitted to the clients because the input user either did not try to submit or had insufficient privileges. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

Click in the System Id column to open a message for further editing. When clicked, the Audit Trail icon will display the user that created the transaction, and any users that have edited, authorised or verified it.

section.title: Message to Bank - Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: This option allows a Message to Bank record that you or another user have already started but been unable to submit, to be submitted by an authorised user.

When selected, this option will present a list of Message to Bank records that have been prepared and saved by users in your bank, but have not been successfully submitted to the clients because the user had insufficient privileges. Records that were simply saved with no attempt to submit them are not included. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.
Click in the System Id column to open the record in a non-editable mode, in order to review the data and perform the submission.

If you have sufficient authorisation in your profile, you can submit multiple records in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which you tick to select it. A button at the end of the page submits all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned, with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the clients, together with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then also displayed.

section.title: BR Maintenance
section.para: This function is user to maintain Received Banker's Guarantee records that were created, but are no longer required in the system.

section.title: BR Maintenance - Set Entity
section.para: List all BR transactions and associate an Entity. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

Click Set Entity and then select System ID. You can now associate an entity for the BR by clicking the search icon
from the Entity field. Click the Submit button to complete the changes.

section.title: BR Maintenance - Set Reference
section.para: Assign a customer reference to a BR record that currently has none.
When you select this option, you are presented with a list of records that have no reference assigned. Click in the System Id column to open a form where you can assign a reference to the record.

note.para: This action is not validated against the Jurisdiction matrix. All transactions of the current files are updated.

section.title: BR Maintenance - Action Required
section.para: List and communicate the action requried for Received Banker's Guarantee transactions.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of records that require customer action. Click on System ID to open and respond or request using the messaging system in the Create a Free Received Banker's Guarantee Format Message (Action Required) page.

section.title: BR Maintenance - Unsigned BRs
section.para: List and optionally delete unsigned (unauthorised) BRs.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of records that are unsigned (unauthorised). You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.

section.title: BR Maintenance - Purged BRs
section.para: List and optionally delete BR transactions that have been marked as Purged by the Issuing Bank's Trade Services team. You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.
